abstract: Morgan Stanley’s executives sounded a bit defensive Wednesday as they sought to explain why the firm’s trading arm posted a loss in the second quarter as rivals like Goldman Sachs raked in billions.
snippet: Morgan Stanley’s executives sounded a bit defensive Wednesday as they sought to explain why the firm’s trading arm posted a loss in the second quarter as rivals like Goldman Sachs raked in billions.
lead_paragraph: Colm Kelleher, Morgan Stanley’s chief financial officer, sounded a bit defensive on Wednesday’s conference call. It’s understandable: He was trying to explain to Wall Street analysts why his securities firm reported a $159 million net loss from continuing operations in the second quarter, as rivals like  Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase raked in billions of dollars in profit.
